item.title: DOOM: The Dark Ages ‘Update 2’ now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Adds "Ripatorium" endless arena mode and more.

Publisher Bethesda Softworks and developer id Software have released the second major update for DOOM: The Dark Ages, which adds the “Ripatorium” endless arena mode, new combat enhancements, and campaign balance refinements.

Here are the details, via Bethesda Softworks:

Features include:

  • Ripatorium Endless Arena Mode
  • New Combat Enhancements for Dragon, Atlan, and Slayer
  • Full-Campaign Balance Changes and Refinements

Stand And Fight as the super weapon of gods and kings, shred enemies with devastating favorites like the Super Shotgun while also wielding a variety of new bone-chewing weapons, including the versatile Shield Saw. Players will stand and fight on the demon-infested battlefields in the vicious, grounded combat the original DOOM is famous for. Take flight atop the new fierce Mecha Dragon, stand tall in a massive Atlan mech, and beat demons to a pulp with the newly enhanced glory kill system. Only the Slayer has the power to wield these devastating tools of mayhem.

Additional details about the update are available at Bethesda.net.

DOOM: The Dark Ages is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store. It is also available via Game Pass.

Watch a new trailer below.

Update 2 Launch Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/doom-the-dark-ages-update-2-now-available

item.title: Go-Go Town! for Switch launches in spring 2026 for Switch and PC, later for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Xbox One
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Currently in Early Access for PC.

Town-building simulation game Go-Go Town! will leave Early Access launch for Switch and PC via Steam in spring 2026, followed later by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One, publisher CULT Games and developer Prideful Sloth announced.

Go-Go Town! first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on June 18, 2024.

“It’s official—Go-Go Town! is coming to Nintendo Switch! It feels like the perfect fit for the game; cozy / chaotic towns, quirky tourists, and pick‑up‑and‑play building on the go,” said Prideful Sloth co-founder and director Joel Styles in a press release. “We can’t wait to see the towns you create when it launches next year.”

Here is an overview of the game, via CULT Games:

Since launching in Early Access on PC, the game has delighted tens of thousands of players with its signature blend of smooth city building that seamlessly scales deep expansion and automation, with chaotic humor that makes every day in office feel like a joy.

Go-Go Town! puts you directly in the boots of the new mayor of a rundown tourist destination. From humble beginnings, you’ll build everything from the ground up – plotting zoning, buildings and subway systems, alongside enticing visitors to move in, hiring workers, keeping shops stocked, automating pipelines and optimizing supply chains. Everything you need to do to make the town thrive, and more importantly, make money!

The Switch version will include all the core features of the PC edition, with all major update content, fully optimized for Switch. It’s the perfect title to pick up and play—whether you’re rebuilding your town on your morning commute or teaming up with friends for some couch co-op chaos.

Go-Go Town! launches for Nintendo Switch in Spring 2026, with more news to come closer to release. In the meantime, players can wishlist the game now on Steam!

Watch a new trailer below.

Switch Release Window Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/go-go-town-for-switch-launches-in-spring-2026-for-switch-and-pc-later-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-and-xbox-one
